pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:0.4.eng: The subchapter on the dark of the night

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ bhaṇḍitvā attānaṃ vadhitvā vadhitvā rodati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.2.eng: the nun Caṇḍakāḷī quarreled with the nuns and then cried after repeatedly beating herself.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.3.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.3.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā caṇḍakāḷī attānaṃ vadhitvā vadhitvā rodissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.4.eng: “How could Venerable Caṇḍakāḷī cry after repeatedly beating herself?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī attānaṃ vadhitvā vadhitvā rodatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Caṇḍakāḷī did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, caṇḍakāḷī bhikkhunī attānaṃ vadhitvā vadhitvā rodissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.8.eng: “How could the nun Caṇḍakāḷī act like this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.10.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.11.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī attānaṃ vadhitvā vadhitvā rodeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a nun cries after repeatedly beating herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:2.1.7.eng: If she cries after repeatedly beating herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:2.1.8.eng: If she beats herself, but does not cry, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:2.1.9.eng: If she cries, but does not beat herself, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:2.2.2.pli: ñātibyasanena vā bhogabyasanena vā rogabyasanena vā phuṭṭhā rodati na vadhati,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:2.2.2.eng: if she cries, but does not beat herself, because of loss of relatives, loss of property, or loss of health;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:2.2.4.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:2.2.5.eng: The tenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc20:2.2.6.eng: The second subchapter on the dark of the night is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhuniyo aciravatiyā nadiyā vesiyāhi saddhiṃ naggā ekatitthe nahāyanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.2.eng: a number of nuns were bathing naked at a ford in the river Aciravatī together with sex workers.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.3.eng: The sex workers teased the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.4.pli: “kiṃ nu kho nāma tumhākaṃ, ayye, daharānaṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciṇṇena, nanu nāma kāmā paribhuñjitabbā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.4.eng: “Venerables, why practice the spiritual life when you’re still young? Why not enjoy worldly pleasures?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.5.pli: Yadā jiṇṇā bhavissatha tadā brahmacariyaṃ carissatha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.5.eng: You can practice the spiritual life when you’re old.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.6.pli: Evaṃ tumhākaṃ ubho atthā pariggahitā bhavissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.6.eng: In this way you’ll get the benefit of both.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.8.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo upassayaṃ gantvā bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.8.eng: They then went to the nuns’ dwelling place and told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.10.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.11.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.11.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.12.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.12.eng: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the nuns for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.13.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.15.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.15.eng: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a nun bathes naked, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:1.16.1.comm: Sp 2.886: Sacepi udakasāṭikacīvaraṁ mahagghaṁ hoti, na sakkā nivāsetvā bahi gantuṁ, evampi naggāya nhāyituṁ vaṭṭati; “Also, if her bathing robe is valuable, or she is unable to put on a lower robe before going outside, then it is allowable to bathe naked.” The implication of this is that this rule concerns outdoor bathing, which fits the origin story.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.1.6.pli: anivatthā vā apārutā vā nahāyati, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.1.6.eng: if she bathes without wearing a sarong or an upper robe, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.1.7.eng: At the end of the bath, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.2.2.eng: if her robes have been stolen or lost;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.2.5.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc21:2.2.6.eng: The first training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:0.5.eng: The training rule on bathing robes

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ udakasāṭikā anuññātā hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.2.eng: At that time the Buddha had allowed bathing robes for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.4.eng: Knowing this, the nuns from the group of six wore bathing robes of inappropriate size.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.5.eng: As they were walking about, they were dragging them along, both in front and behind.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.6.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo appamāṇikāyo udakasāṭikāyo dhāressantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six wear such bathing robes?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo appamāṇikāyo udakasāṭikāyo dhārentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns from the group of six do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo appamāṇikāyo udakasāṭikāyo dhāressanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six wear such bathing robes?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.14.1.pli: “Udakasāṭikaṃ pana bhikkhuniyā kārayamānāya pamāṇikā kāretabbā. Tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ—dīghaso catasso vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ dve vidatthiyo. Taṃ atikkāmentiyā chedanakaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun is having a bathing robe made, it should be made the right size. This is the right size: four standard handspans long and two wide. If it exceeds that, it is to be cut down, and she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:1.14.1.comm: For an explanation of the rendering of sugata as “standard” and of vidatthi as “handspan”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.2.eng: wearing it as a sarong, she bathes.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.4.pli: karontiyā vā kārāpentiyā vā. Pamāṇikā kāretabbā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.4.eng: making it herself or having someone else make it, it should be made the right size.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.5.pli: Tatridaṃ pamāṇaṃ— dīghaso catasso vidatthiyo, sugatavidatthiyā; tiriyaṃ dve vidatthiyo.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.5.eng: This is the right size: four standard handspans long and two wide.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.6.pli: Taṃ atikkāmetvā karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.6.eng: If she makes one or has one made that exceeds that, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.7.eng: When she gets it, it is to be cut down, and she is then to confess an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.8.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.8.1.eng: If she finishes what she began herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.9.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.9.eng: If she has others finish what she began herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.10.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.10.eng: If she finishes herself what was begun by others, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.11.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.11.eng: If she has others finish what was begun by others, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.12.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.12.eng: If she makes one or has one made for the benefit of someone else, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.13.pli: Aññena kataṃ paṭilabhitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.1.13.eng: If she gets one that was made by someone else and then uses it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.2.2.eng: if she makes it the right size;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.2.3.eng: if she makes it smaller than the right size;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.2.4.pli: aññena kataṃ pamāṇātikkantaṃ paṭilabhitvā chinditvā paribhuñjati,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.2.4.eng: if she gets one made by someone else that exceeds the right size and she cuts it down before using it;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.2.5.pli: vitānaṃ vā bhūmattharaṇaṃ vā sāṇipākāraṃ vā bhisiṃ vā bibbohanaṃ vā karoti,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.2.5.eng: if she makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.2.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc22:2.2.8.eng: The second training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:0.5.eng: The training rule on sewing robes

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarissā bhikkhuniyā mahagghe cīvaradusse cīvaraṃ dukkaṭaṃ hoti dussibbitaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.2.eng: At that time a robe belonging to a certain nun had been badly made and badly sewn from expensive robe-cloth.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.3.eng: The nun Thullanandā said to her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.5.eng: but the robe has been badly made and badly sewn.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.6.eng: “If I unstitch it, will you sew it back together?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.8.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī taṃ cīvaraṃ visibbetvā thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā adāsi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.8.eng: Then that nun unstitched the robe and gave it to Thullanandā.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.10.pli: “sibbissāmi sibbissāmī”ti neva sibbati na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.10.eng: repeatedly said she would sew it, she neither sewed it herself nor did she make any effort to have someone else do it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.11.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.11.eng: That nun then told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.12.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.12.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ visibbāpetvā neva sibbissati na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.13.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā have a nun’s robe unstitched, and then neither sew it herself nor make any effort to have someone else do it?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.14.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ visibbāpetvā neva sibbati na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karotī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.14.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.17.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ visibbāpetvā neva sibbissati na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.17.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā act like this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.19.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.19.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.20.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ visibbetvā vā visibbāpetvā vā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva sibbeyya na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ kareyya, aññatra catūhapañcāhā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:1.20.1.eng: ‘If a nun, after unstitching a nun’s robe or having it unstitched, neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to have someone else sew it, and there were no obstacles, then, except if it was no more than four or five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.1.8.eng: one of the six kinds of robes.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.1.12.eng: she has someone else unstitch it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.1.16.eng: she does not sew it herself.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.1.17.eng: Nor makes any effort to have someone else sew it:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.1.18.eng: she does not ask anyone else.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.1.19.eng: Except if it was no more than four or five days:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.1.20.eng: unless it was no more than four or five days.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.1.21.pli: “Neva sibbissāmi na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karissāmī”ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.1.21.eng: If she thinks, “I’ll neither sew it nor make any effort to have someone else sew it,” then by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.1.pli: Upasampannāya upasampannasaññā cīvaraṃ visibbetvā vā visibbāpetvā vā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva sibbati na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karoti, aññatra catūhapañcāhā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she unstitches her robe or has it unstitched, and then neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to have someone else sew it, and there were no obstacles, then, except if it was no more than four or five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.2.pli: Upasampannāya vematikā cīvaraṃ visibbetvā vā visibbāpetvā vā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva sibbati na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karoti, aññatra catūhapañcāhā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she unstitches her robe or has it unstitched, and then neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to have someone else sew it, and there were no obstacles, then, except if it was no more than four or five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.3.pli: Upasampannāya anupasampannasaññā cīvaraṃ visibbetvā vā visibbāpetvā vā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva sibbati na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karoti, aññatra catūhapañcāhā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she unstitches her robe or has it unstitched, and then neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to have someone else sew it, and there were no obstacles, then, except if it was no more than four or five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.4.pli: Aññaṃ parikkhāraṃ visibbetvā vā visibbāpetvā vā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva sibbati na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karoti, aññatra catūhapañcāhā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.4.eng: If she unstitches another requisite or has it unstitched, and then neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to have someone else sew it, and there were no obstacles, then, except if it was no more than four or five days, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.5.pli: Anupasampannāya cīvaraṃ vā aññaṃ vā parikkhāraṃ visibbetvā vā visibbāpetvā vā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva sibbati na sibbāpanāya ussukkaṃ karoti, aññatra catūhapañcāhā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.5.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she unstitches her robe or another requisite, or has it unstitched, and then neither sews it herself nor makes any effort to have someone else sew it, and there were no obstacles, then, except if it was no more than four or five days, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.6.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.7.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.2.8.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.3.3.eng: if she searches for someone to sew, but does not find anyone;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.3.4.eng: if she is doing it, but she takes longer than four or five days;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.3.8.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc23:2.3.9.eng: The third training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:0.5.eng: The training rule on moving the robes

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhuniyo bhikkhunīnaṃ hatthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena janapadacārikaṃ pakkamanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns stored one of their robes with other nuns and then left to wander the country in a sarong and an upper robe.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.3.pli: Tāni cīvarāni ciraṃ nikkhittāni kaṇṇakitāni honti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.3.eng: Because they were stored for a long time, the robes became moldy.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.4.eng: When the nuns put them out to sun them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.7.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.7.eng: And they told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.8.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.8.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo bhikkhunīnaṃ hatthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena janapadacārikaṃ pakkamissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.9.eng: “How can nuns store one of their robes with other nuns and then go wandering the country in a sarong and an upper robe?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo bhikkhunīnaṃ hatthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena janapadacārikaṃ pakkamantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.10.eng: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo bhikkhunīnaṃ hatthe cīvaraṃ nikkhipitvā santaruttarena janapadacārikaṃ pakkamissanti.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.15.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.16.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī pañcāhikaṃ saṅghāṭicāraṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a nun does not move her robes for more than five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.16.1.comm: “Move (her) robes” renders saṅghāṭicāra. Sp 2.898: Saṅghāṭīnaṁ cāro saṅghāṭicāro, “Saṅghāṭicāra is the moving of the robes.” For the meaning of saṅghāṭi, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.1.5.eng: Does not move her robes for more than five days:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.1.6.pli: pañcamaṃ divasaṃ pañca cīvarāni neva nivāseti na pārupati na otāpeti, pañcamaṃ divasaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.1.6.eng: if she does not wear or sun her five robes on the fifth day, then, when the fifth day has passed, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.1.eng: If it is more than five days, and she perceives it as more, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.2.eng: If it is more than five days, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.3.eng: If it is more than five days, but she perceives it as less, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.4.eng: If it is less than five days, but she perceives it as more, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.5.eng: If it is less than five days, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.6.eng: If it is less than five days and she perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.2.pli: pañcamaṃ divasaṃ pañca cīvarāni nivāseti vā pārupati vā otāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.2.eng: if she wears or suns the five robes on the fifth day;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.7.eng: The fourth training rule is finished.
